thread.title: New England College Football: Western Connecticut edges MMA in final seconds
thread.title_full: New England College Football: Western Connecticut edges MMA in final seconds

author: From wire reports
title: New England College Football: Western Connecticut edges MMA in final seconds
text: Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 10:02 PM By From wire reports Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 10:02 PM » Social News DANBURY, Conn. -- Junior Michael Nicol’s three-yard touchdown run with nine seconds remaining lifted Western Connecticut to a wild 46-39 Massachusetts State Collegiate Athletic Conference football victory over Massachusetts Maritime Saturday afternoon at the Westside Athletic Complex. A game that featured a combined 192 plays from scrimmage and nearly 1,200 yards of total offense also saw the two teams exchange leads on nine occasions, including twice in the final 62 seconds of play. The dramatic finish came shortly after the visiting Buccaneers (2-3, 1-2 MASCAC) had rallied from a seven-point deficit (38-31) with just 1:44 remaining. After stopping the hosts on their own 28-yard line, MMA drove 72 yards in just four plays to take the lead on sophomore Kenny Pierce’s 14-yard touchdown run and a two-point conversion pass from senior quarterback Brad Skeffington to junior Jonathan Furtado. Skeffington amassed 374 yards of total offense in the setback for the Bucs, as he completed 18-of-47 passing attempts for 279 yards and four touchdowns while rushing for a team-best 95 yards on 24 carries. Furtado hauled in eight catches for 95 yards to go with his two scores and two-point conversion for the Buccaneers, who also received a 100-yard receiving day from Shane Haggerty. Pierce was a yard shy of reaching the 100-yard mark in all-purpose yards for the visitors, who also received 67 rushing yards from sophomore Richie Phillips (Onset). Bowling Green 62, UMass 38: Matt Johnson completed 33 of 39 passes for 450 yards and five touchdowns to lead host Bowling Green to a win over UMass. Travis Greene rushed for 122 yards and a touchdown on 15 carries and was one of five different players with a receiving touchdown for the Falcons (4-2, 2-0 Mid-American Conference). Blake Frohnapfel went 34 of 56 for 409 yards for the Minutemen (1-4, 0-1) with Tajae Sharpe catching 13 passes for 156 yards. Harvard 40, Cornell 3: Scott Hosch threw three touchdown passes and ran for another score and Harvard beat Cornell 40-3 in Ithaca, N.Y. to win its 18th straight game. The Crimson (4-0, 2-0 Ivy League) outgained Cornell (0-4, 0-2) 499 total yards to 192 and converted one of three interceptions and a fumble into scores. Brown 25, Holy Cross 24: Grant Senne kicked a 35-yard field goal with 2:06 left to help Brown beat Holy Cross in Worcester. Peter Pujals hooked up with Jake Wieczorek for a 5-yard touchdown pass early in the third to give the Crusaders (2-3) to a 24-22 lead. Brown (2-2) led 22-17 at intermission. Dartmouth 35, Yale 3: Dalyn Williams passed for a career-high 435 yards and four touchdowns to help Dartmouth remain undefeated. Cameron Skaff had two touchdown catches for the Big Green (4-0, 2-0 Ivy League). Yale (3-1, 1-1), which came into the game averaging more than 457 yards and nearly 30 points per game, was limited to a season-low 276 total yards. URI 20, Delaware 0: Harold Cooper ran for a career-best 123 yards and a touchdown and host Rhode Island picked up its first victory of the season. It was the Rams (1-5, 1-2 Colonial Athletic) first win over Delaware (2-4, 1-2) since 2011. UConn 40, Central Florida 13: Bryan Shirreffs threw for 256 yards and a touchdown and ran for another score and UConn snapped a three-game losing streak with a victory over winless Central Florida in an American Athletic Conference game in Orlando. Shirreffs generated two scores in the final 57 seconds of the first half that helped the Huskies (3-3, 1-1) take a 23-3 halftime lead. Maine 39, Albany 7: Dan Collins and Drew Belcher combined for four touchdowns, leading the visiting Black Bears. Collins led Maine (2-3, 2-1 Colonial) on three first-quarter touchdown drives, building a 20-0 lead. D.J. Crook's 6-yard touchdown pass to Zee Roberson got Albany (2-4, 1-2) on the scoreboard with less than three minutes left in the second quarter. The former Barnstable quarterback was 17 of 30 for 167 yards and two interceptions. Central Connecticut State 35, Bryant 33: Cameron Nash had 104 yards receiving, 102 in kickoff returns, 90 rushing and a touchdown to lift Central Connecticut State past Bryant in Mansfield, Conn. The Blue Devils (2-4, 1-1 Northeast Conference) overcame a 20-7 third quarter deficit. Falmouth’s John Lavin caught three passes for 29 yards for Bryant (2-3, 0-1). Amherst 24, Middlebury 7: Former St. John Paul II standout Diego Meritus combined for 70 yards rushing and receiving but the Panthers fell to host Lord Jeffs. By From wire reports
